website_summaries.verdict: This 16-inch Oregan bar and chain power tool is ready for heavy duty and can handle roughly 70 cuts per charge.
pros: Heavy-duty chainsaw ideal for construction and outdoor cutting
Makes up to 70 cuts per charge
Tool-free chain tensioning and continuous lubrication with auto-lubing feature
cons: Trigger set up like DeWalt power tools, not like a chainsaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw...No case
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic saw for the money! Only drawback...no case. After contacting DeWalt they don’t offer nor will offer a case anytime soon. I did some research and found a gent who found a case that will hold this saw almost like a glove! I’ve attached my photos with the Amazon part number for reference. Gave it only 4 stars for the missing case. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: BigTroy427

customer_reviews.title: Battery clarification
customer_reviews.text: Many reviewers stated they received the 9 amp hour battery with their purchase, when the description said the saw comes with a 3 amp hour battery. The details of the battery can be confusing to some... The largest dewalt 60v battery currently available (to my knowledge) is rated at 3 ah at 60v, and rated at 9 ah at 20v. So, the Amazon description is correct, and no one has been mistakenly sent a higher capacity battery. The included battery is their biggest one available.
customer_reviews.author: sickst6

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as gas!
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect to like this saw but I love it! Being a petite female I always struggled with starting my gas saws. No pull starts, no gas mixing; battery makes more cuts than I thought it would and doesn't take forever to recharge. The tool less chain tightening is handy. I love everything about it! UPDATE: I still love this saw. I've replaced the chain a few times and have been clearing a large area with it. It has been amazing. I'll never go back to struggling with a pull start gas powered saw again.
customer_reviews.author: W. Waller

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. Just a response to those asking about ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Just a response to those asking about spare chain. Uses the same chain as the 40v chainsaw per Dewalt part number. Reading reviews of the 40v it is said replacement chain is an Oregon R56. Can buy at Lowes for $18.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this saw
customer_reviews.text: It leaks bar oil like a sieve. I called Dewalt and they said that you have to drain the bar oil after every use. Seriously?!? That is a crap answer and if that is the case then they should have but a drain plug on the unit so you can get the oil out without getting over the place. IF YOU RETHINK OF BUYING THIS SAW JUST BURN YOUR MONEY INSTEAD..less aggravating
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: This is no Homelite toy saw. I purchased this to clear small trees and brush. Which it did with no issue. So as any good American I needed to know the limits of this new tool that just blew away my expectations. Dropped and cut up a 15" diamator hemlock like a hot knife thru butter. 3 two-stroke chain saws for sale if anyone wants em. My days of mixing gas and excessive noise are over. 60 volt brushless for the win.
customer_reviews.author: Kory T

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 month of use.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this chainsaw when it worked for a month. I bought it in June but have not used it till March cutting down trees at a new house. It was working great with plenty of power and battery life but failed after only 1 month, I have lots of 60 and 20 volt dewalt tools I hope this is a fluke tool and dewalt will warranty replace it. If not 1 month out of a tool is not worth buying. I'm disappointed as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Rauch Jr

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions = great
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a week. Went to work on some mulberry trees today. It worked great. Great power and runtime. Much easier than messing with gas and oil for small around the house projects. (you still need bar oil)
customer_reviews.author: Wade Thoene

customer_reviews.title: Have never been as disappointed in a DeWalt Product as I am with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Have never been as disappointed in a DeWalt Product as I am with this one. Actually the rest of my 20V tools are great and work well for whatever job i put them too. This was my into into the 60V flexvolt line. Run time with the 60V 6ah batteries is disappointing. The self oiling system doesn't seem to get to the chain and smoke appears within seconds. Ill be taking it directly back to DeWalt and am now have two 60V batteries that will just have to be used with my 20V... Hopefully they
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Christman

customer_reviews.title: What a let down!
customer_reviews.text: We live on heavily wooded property and my husband likes to do his own work, so I like to give him good tools. I thought this would be a good tool. It really isn’t. The oil goes everywhere except on the chain, and when the chain runs dry, (which is inevitable) it comes off. Of course you can’t return this to Amazon, so this is an expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: More than happy with new saw
customer_reviews.text: More than happy with new saw. I had high expectations for this battery chainsaw so i cut this 25" white oak log to make its first cut. It never bogged and cut clean wish I had it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Chain tightner failed within few hours
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until after about 5 hours (11 months) of fairly light use, the tool-less chain tightner tightening wheel totally quit working. Totally unacceptable for a saw this expensive from a great company like Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: C Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very defective product
customer_reviews.text: This is a defective product. After one use, the insides melted. I took it to the warranty center. A new one was mailed. Same story.. An experienced landscaper used it and made sure there was oil even on the chain. Very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Finally Moving On

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use!
customer_reviews.text: Broke after one use. ONE USE! We didn't do anything crazy with it, just cutting fire wood. And I'm over the short alloted time to return it. What a waste. What an expensive waste.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Almost competes with Gas!!
customer_reviews.text: I normally am not a fan of battery powered yard tools. You sacrifice power, convenience, and just that cool factor that comes with a 2 stroke, or better yet, a 4 stroke engine. I wanted a gas chainsaw, but since we have neighbors close by, my wife talked me out of it. Lugging around an extension cord...., no one wants to do that. The battery powered was the compromise. To my surprise, this was not a compromise at all. It has power, is quiet, good size, good battery life, and looks cool. A bit on the pricey side, but well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Attention to Detail

customer_reviews.title: Chain won’t tighten .
customer_reviews.text: Used when I first bought and it was perfect, however after 40 days went to use it again, it worked fine but then it got dirty went to take the chain off to clean and now it won’t tighten ,very disappointed.dewalt is usually pretty good I don’t know what happened to this one .
customer_reviews.author: Just a nobody

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Lots of power
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Lots of power. My first 60v tool. But I bought the skill saw after. These both are incredible. Game changers in my option. Battery tech has reached a ridiculous level now. Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: E. Newell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this junk
customer_reviews.text: Sprocket design is very different from a typical saw and is very flawed. They need to have a real sprocket not a gear and washer. The chain will pop off randomly and the washer will fall out. Very disappointed in this product design.
customer_reviews.author: jhnblgr

customer_reviews.title: Oil Fill Cap will not open.
customer_reviews.text: New (out of the box) Dewalt chainsaw oil fill cap will not open. Called Dewalt and they said this was a common factory defect. We will return the chainsaw to Amazon as recommended by Dewalt. The Dewalt service person did not recommend using their warranty/service facilities. I will not purchase a Dewalt product again.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god! I love how beautifully powerful and effortless this chainsaw is. Obviously, being that it's battery it doesn't make any noise until you pull the trigger; but when you do, it quickly revs to life and mows stuff down like nobody's business! Of course, I'm not a tree cutting expert nor do I cut down anything major. For the average consumer, it can be a bit of a overkill. But the quality and strength of the 60v makes this chainsaw worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Khoi Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chainsaw for moderate sized trees. Lighter weight than many gas saws but no liquid fuels to mess with. Cuts fast and battery lasts reasonably well. Chain oil cap is easy to access and has a retainer so it doesn't get lost. 🔧less Chain tensioner is easy to use. One complaint is that the battery is sort of difficult to remove. You have to pull up on the battery somehow to get it out of its tight fit slot / compartment ... but there is no good grab handle on the battery. Takes some wiggling or prying.
customer_reviews.author: amazonoid

customer_reviews.title: Like a Hot Knife through Butter!
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a battery operated Chain Saw. The DeWalt DCCS670B FLEXVOLT 60V MAX Brushless Chain Saw cuts timber like a "Hot Knife through Butter." I would recommend this chain saw to any home owner. It's clean and very handy. There's no need for gas/oil mixtures, and, most of all, no more cord pulling of any kind; the saw starts at the pull of a trigger. It is so easy to use. This thing works great! I will definitely be buying from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Cisne Grande

customer_reviews.title: Worked Til it didn’t
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first. Cut beautifully for any saw, not just electric. About the fourth time using the saw, and they have all been light duty, the motor stopped, and smoke emitted form the saw. This saw was not worked hard, and therefore is unreliable. Wanted it for a truck saw to keep in the back in case of emergencies. My worst DeWalt purchase. Most of there other tools have been great.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I used twice cutting odds and ends, nothing massive. Went to use a third time and entire saw is dead. Battery is fully charged, but saw will not turn on. Returning for a refund from manufacturer. Just bought this in April, about 70 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: mike goodwick

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw but it leaks
customer_reviews.text: The saw cuts well but their is considerable leakage of the bar and chain oil. Not only does this waste oil but it makes a mess on the garage floor and complicates traveling with the saw. Unfortunate too that the saw does not come with a case, nor is one available from Dewalt, to help control this problem. I have only had the saw about 8 months and may find a fix yet. So far I have cut mostly limbs up to 10" dia. Because of the leakage problem I can not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: keagman

customer_reviews.title: Should I give it another chance..?
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great until it died. After 20 min the chain came off. I put it back on and retensioned it. Oil and battery were full. From then on it would stop and start and then stop for good. I sent it back. I decided to order a 40V 4AH model for $305 plus tax. The price had jumped on the 60V 3AH by $45. This is the only DeWalt tool I own so I don't need a flexvolt. The 40V 4AH is actually said to be more powerful. Not as fast, but more powerful as it has 2 battery cells vs one for the 60V 3AH. It should also run longer. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: finding z zero

customer_reviews.title: True Love
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my DCCS670, There are many chainsaws, but only one DCCS670. This is going to take some getting use to with the Oil, having to empty it when not using the DCCS670. But I will tolerate it because this is true love and we were destined to be together me & my DCCS670. I will always take care of it, I will always fill DCCS670 with clean oil before each use and drain it afterwards. Gosh, I am blushing thinking of the first time I had the DCCS670 in my hands and hearing it run. Wow. True Love.
customer_reviews.author: System Admin

customer_reviews.title: What happened DeWalt?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this item. The first had to be returned within two weeks because it failed. It worked well during those weeks. ThIs second purchase had a faulty battery and or battery charger, but the chainsaw works. The manufacturer sent a new battery and charger but it is not holding a charge or charging the original battery. I am ready to return it all despite the chainsaw’s excellent features. What happened Dewalt? Are the components being manufactured in the cheap at different locations? I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mainely family

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use this chain saw around my property to fell trees for firewood. The saw is very easy to maintain and adjust. I like that it doesn't use gasoline. On a single batteries charge you can fell and process a large tree's worth of firewood. The batteries charge quickly but they are very expensive. When you're weighing the cost and benefits of this saw, that should be figured into your calculations. To me this is the main issue with this tool and the reason it is a 4 star rather than a 5 star item. The battery also makes the saw quite heavy compared to other gas and electric chain saws.
customer_reviews.author: Malcom macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Great job Dewalt!
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap this thing rocks! Awesome addition to my other gas saws. Sometimes you need something small, but that dosen't mean it doesn't have power. Lots of good torque. The bigger amp batteries obviously last longer but man you can make a lot of cuts on 2 batteries. Like mentioned in other reviews it does leak a little oil just sitting. Other than that it really can tackle a lot. I have 40 acres and burn wood in winter and this gets used almost as much as the Stilh and Dolmer.
customer_reviews.author: MDJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: Update. Just wanted to confirm that this item DOES leak a significant amount of oil even when set on a flat surface. I need to keep cardboard under it so it doesn’t make a mess. This is a great product but cutting larger logs drains the battery. Takes longer than I would like to recharge the battery... but I'm used to the smaller 20v that charge quickly. The oil didn't leak for me yet as I read in other reviews. The oil does seem to go quickly so you should check it often. The oil plug is sturdy so far but I feel like I could break it if not careful. All in all, I'm happy with buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love Dewalt Flexvolt Tools
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. Haven't picked up my Stihl 20 inch since I got this one. My wife is even cutting down trees with it given how easy it is to use and is light weight. I already had 3 Flexvolt batteries for my table saw and like their system so its easy to always have one ready to go. And the Flexvolt works with almost all of the 20v tools as well. Have not been disappointed in cutting ability. Have added the pole saw and will be adding the blower and trimmer soon. Will be adding the Flexvolt sliding miter saw when I win the lottery.
customer_reviews.author: DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Useful, lightweight, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my husband. I know.... that's like buying a vacuum as a Christmas present right? :-) But he really likes this chainsaw. He was tired of wearing out his arm when pulling the starter cord on gas-powered chainsaws. This one starts easily, is lightweight, holds a charge, and does the job smoothly. He's had this for a little over a month and has not used the gas chainsaws at all, only this one! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Foodie

customer_reviews.title: OK, but plenty of issues
customer_reviews.text: First day was fine. Later on, different issues popped, like oil leaking, chain coming off, and random gaps in cutting power. Seems that my 50 dollar electrical one is more reliable that this one. I would consider buying again if I am certain it will perform.
customer_reviews.author: FLA Texts

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. I use mine when I am out clearing invasive trees, I carry it on the cat and it is always there and ready to work it doesn't leak oil when idle. No more trying to start contacerous gas saws for a cut or two. I do wish they made a case for this saw to protect it from the elements. I know I will eventually leave it in the back of truck and it will get rain on:(
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This is what you've been waiting - a chainsaw with NO cursing necessary
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes running a chainsaw the fun it can be. No torment with yanking the cord, no excessive noise. This chainsaw is ready when you need it, quiet when you don't. It cuts as well as any gas saw. The chain is simple to remove and replace. The oil is simple to refill. I could have saved SO MANY curse words if I had just had this thing a few years sooner. But I am happy now and there is work getting done.
customer_reviews.author: Suzannah

customer_reviews.title: Going to love this thing! I can feel it.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but I fired it up and I knew real quick I loved it. I own quite a few rentals and always have a tenant calling saying they have a branch down. This Dewalt is going to be so much easier loading up and running over there real quick and cutting up the branch.. I'm a huge Stihl fan, but I've always wanted one these. This was on sale for $289.00, and it came with a 60v 6AH battery. The battery is much bigger than what was advertised. Can't wait to use the Chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Ouch

customer_reviews.title: Super capable Dewalt Flexvolt chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I had originally bought this saw for general use. I did not know Hurricane Sally would be hitting the Pensacola area. I was amazed at the strength and run time of this saw. This is a 32” diameter tree and the saw cut through it like butter. The four cuts you see in the one picture was done with one 9 ah 60 volt battery that came with it. I had spares but did not have to use them. This saw is just amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Comtool

customer_reviews.title: Nice light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me after I complained his gas powered one was too heavy. It is very easy to use and I like the easy start. I highly recommend for women that would like to use chainsaws but are skittish or can’t hold the weight of gas powered ones. Has long battery life. Works so well my husband uses it every chance he can get it away from me while we are clearing property. Makes easy work of trimming cedar trees.
customer_reviews.author: Breen1234

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised -
customer_reviews.text: Having used gas powered chainsaws my whole life, I was skeptical that anything running with a battery would manage heavy cutting. I just made quick work of a fallen tree in my back yard & it didn't break a sweat. Also - much quieter than a conventional saw. Goodbye blisters due to pull cords & balking motors, mixing 2-stroke fuel and gummed up carburetors. No idea how it will fare over the years ... but right out of the box, this thing is a home run.
customer_reviews.author: Durt

customer_reviews.title: Best chainsaw I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I made the change from gas to electric, because my guys have screwed up a few of my chainsaws, mainly from bad ethanal gas sitting in them, and the guys running them too hot. I have been impressed with every aspect of the saw. It may lack a tiny bit of power from gas, but this bar just seems to cut better, and at the end of the day, I get as much done or more with this electric saw. no major breakdowns, or the chain coming loose. The chain needs tightening about 90% less than gas, I don't know why. Love this thing, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Brown

customer_reviews.title: Electric Chainsaws are Becoming Really Good!!⚡
customer_reviews.text: Cut through 8 and 10" oak for about twenty cuts and still had 1 energy bar on my 9amp 60 volt battery. Per Dewalts information guide, 1 bar on the battery equates to 50% or less juice on the battery. I really like this chainsaw! Cut like a knife through hot butter, and hasn't leaked bar oil like others have mentioned. I'm using a thicker husqvarna bar oil. Highly recommended! Update 8/30/18.... Still running great, with no oil leaking, and still chewing threw 8"+ hardwood for summer fires and fallen trees on property.
customer_reviews.author: Sampson Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but a few things to point out.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm very impressed with the saw. I've used it for clearing out the treeline on my property which is usually trees and bushes from 1 to 6". The saw cuts fast. You have to be aware since the noise is so low compared to a gas saw. The battery is big and although well balanced, it's not as light as say a plug in saw but probably comparable to a small gas saw. I noticed that it uses a good amount of oil and that you are probably going to have to fill the oil before you need to charge the battery which outlasted me by far. No case but does have a chain guard. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: big bill

customer_reviews.title: Solid feel, good power, light weight
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a Stihl gas saw that failed. In a half hour of clearing a trail I liked the feel and cutting sped. The battery showed more than 3/4 power but a better test will be when the chain begins to dull. Not dealing with gas is a big plus. Overall a very good saw for the light work I'm doing now. Lithium battery which isn't expected to degrade from being left on charge but I remove mine after charging. Given replacement cost I plan to baby the battery. Chain oil leaks onto the shelf during storage as others report.
customer_reviews.author: Woods39

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw - Battery Problem
customer_reviews.text: I was quite surprised with how good this saw performs. The oil reservoir leaks but it's supposed to as that's how it oils the chain. After two charge-ups, the battery, the DCB609 ($200) won't charge. When inserted into the charger, the light flickers and then goes out and that's it. Nothing more happens. Yes, of course, I've tested the battery with other chargers and other batteries with the saw charger - same result. Amazon offered me a $37 credit, or I could return the entire thing. Trouble with that is, four weeks later, the box is gone and the packaging is gone. I've written DeWalt and will report back what they tell me.
customer_reviews.author: RB601

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great chainsaw. I’ve got two stihl and a Husky gas saws and this one is just as good. This thing isn’t light with the battery in so don’t expect a break in weight but it’s nice not to pour gas and yank a cord or like with my Husky I have to push in the compression release. Just slap that giant battery in and go. Lasted all day of cutting b4 it needed a charge. The battery lasted longer then I did.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, you will be happy.
customer_reviews.text: What a beast! Lots of power and quality, yet quieter and less noxious than gas. Don’t have to worry about E85 gas ruining another 2 stroke engine. And the best part is, my wife loves it. She can handle it easily and being electric eliminates the biggest drawback for her which was dealing with the gas. I’ll be buying more tools on the 60v Max platform. Dewalt really got this one right, as they always do.
customer_reviews.author: Lee K.

customer_reviews.title: Minor design flaws, learning to live with them
customer_reviews.text: Tension control is not reliable, the chain slid off from time to time. The issue there is that the guide teeth get bended. As result it is not easy to re-assamble or you would have to use new chain altogether. Cover holder on ratchet mechanism without counter. I would prefer something more solid. This can be an issue with the chain alignment control as well. Other than that it is about 80% replacement for the gas powered chain saw in my day-to-day activities. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Smirnov

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 10 hrs use
customer_reviews.text: When it ran, it worked well. Safe and maneuverable, but after 10 hours it died, despite trying with multiple fresh batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats a gas powered unit
customer_reviews.text: It became a test of wills for me to start my gas-powered chainsaw. I bought this unit. I have used it many times. It cuts well, has lots of power. Soooo happy I bought this. I have trimmed off major limbs from trees (at ground level), cut big logs down to a size that will burn easily in the fireplace. If you need a chain saw, get this one. I buy DeWalt and find their products very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor of many years

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this Chainsaw. The charger is a tad slow otherwise I would have given the combo a total five star review. Once the battery is charged, the saw itself is a total five stars. I went to work on a bush in my front yard which had limbs on average of 6” thicknesses with some sections up to 8-10”. This saw made short work of it all on one charge and had plenty of torque on par with my pullpan gas saw that would not start anymore because it sat unused for several years. Love the battery powered grab and go with no fuss. Tottaly worth it and this machine has good performance as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Online Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is exactly what I was expecting. Did about three hours of cutting the other day, nothing bigger than 5" and the battery was still about 70%. It is light and more manageable than a gas saw. Also better for step ladder work since it will not turn on with the brake engaged. My only real concern is continued support by DeWalt and the actual life of the battery. At 100 dollars each, it will be rough once this one quits taking a charge.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleasantly suprised.
customer_reviews.text: Has the feel of a gas chainsaw with half the noise. Had a full charge when I made 4 trunk cuts around 20" thick with no issue. Then cleared 20-25 smaller 2" trees and shrubs and battery still showed fully charged. Saw sat for about a week, cut down two more 20" - 25" trees and quartered them before I needed to charge again. I have no complaints, love this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Michaniel

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: after fighting with blade changes on echo and sthil chainsaws i like the design. great power no issue. extra batteries is the same as a gas can but without the chance of... fire.. upsides, no continuous running starting and restarting, no 2cycle mixing no carbon monoxide (remodeling monster for inside work). only downside is no hard case.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Block

customer_reviews.title: Great Electric Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dislike is there is not an included or an optional hard plastic gasket sealed carrying case for the chainsaw. The battery life is quite impressive! Cut up three huge 10 inch limbs from an oak tree and there is still 1/3 battery remaining. The auto oil feature for the chain works like a dream! But DeWalt, come out with a carrying case made for this saw!!!
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Bar nut is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waist your money, plenty of power but chain adjuster and bar stop are plastic and Chain comes Loose and nut stripped, also no Metal dogs to dig in, buy a Milwaukee
customer_reviews.author: adam s.

customer_reviews.title: I loved this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I loved this chainsaw! I am a 62 year old lady who likes to use a chainsaw for cleaning up brush, etc. I was delighted with the power and battery life as I was worn out before the battery died! However, the chain keeps slipping off! I am returning as I feel that this is a defect that Dewalt needs to look in to.
customer_reviews.author: Old FIlm Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade from my stinky gas powered saw
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is the fresh bar & chain and new battery, but this thing is a wonder. We had trees down all over the place, it got through the downed bits incredibly fast. The battery makes it a bit heavy and it does go through bar oil - keep an eye on that - the viewing window is not so great. Did I mention that it barely drains the battery?
customer_reviews.author: JeffGo

customer_reviews.title: Broken oil cap
customer_reviews.text: Oil cap didn't open and I broke it. Somebody screwed it in too tight. Absolutely awful flaw. Have to send this crap back and pay for shipping now.
customer_reviews.author: Stanislav

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Long Lasting Battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to sit in my patrol car as needed for weather events. I charged it and left in my car, using it on occasion with no issues. It sat for two months without use and we had a Tornado go through, many trees down on the road but was able to pull this out of the trunk with no new charge and tackled 6 trees of varying sizes across the county and there was still plenty of power left for more. I was impressed with how easy it was to use and how long the battery held its charge. I can't recommend this tool more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s worth it! Took me a while to decide which one I wanted. This is definitely worth it. Excellent for small farm or an outdoorsman clear out trails. The chain that comes on it isn’t the best. Mine went out fairly quickly but I put on a higher quality from a well known brand and it’s been working great!
customer_reviews.author: Jibran Tahirkheli

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice saw for the home owner. The saw handles good and has good power. As for the oil leaking most saws with automatic oiling leak unless you drain the oil reservoir before you put them away. This is nothing to upset about. I do not know about the battery life as I have used it long enough to run the battery done.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Rod

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this chainsaw for about 5 battery charges. Then the motor suddenly gave a spark and died. Sent it to DeWalt for warranty. Took them 3 months to return it. Used it for about 10 minutes and the motor died again. Now I'm trying to decide whether to send it back again or just throw the p.o.s. in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.A.

customer_reviews.title: Wow - I am sold.
customer_reviews.text: I so did not think I was ready to give up my gasser. I'm impressed. The start-up torque is miles ahead of a 2-stroke cheap 'Wild'. Since it doesn't have a spinning clutch, it's very 'instant on'. It's clean, reasonably quiet, and super cool to simply pull a trigger w/ no regard to trying to pull a starter rope and dealing w/ stalls etc. It only took once to the woods to sell me - gasser's went to Craig's List the very same weekend. Battery last at least as long as a tank of gas on the Wild. No concerns at all.
customer_reviews.author: JBird

customer_reviews.title: a great alternative to gas
customer_reviews.text: this thing actually works. I use this daily at my job, cutting down full sized trees. My employees are impressed with it's power as well. a great alternative to gas. other alternatives may have more voltage, but I think that number is arbitrary in this case
customer_reviews.author: nicholas f.

customer_reviews.title: SO SURPRISED!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has got SOOOoo much power!!! I have a hard time using my Husbands Gas Powered Chainsaw but this is so much lighter and the POWER IS INCREDIBLE!!!! I can't say enough good about this product. My Husband is a General Contractor and he is a DeWalt Man ALL THE WAY so it was a no brainer when we saw this baby!! EVERYTHING and then some as for what was expected from this Chainsaw! LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: LyndaZP

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS LIKE A SIEVE. Other than that, it's easy to use, very light. Charges quickly.
customer_reviews.text: LEAKS LIKE A SIEVE. Other than that so far it works great. No problems with power, or chain issues. Just be realistic in how large of a tree you're trying to cut. I have been using it mostly for smaller trees and delimbing larger firewood. Great so far. I can cut for about 45 minutes on one charge. A way around it leaking all over the place is not to completely fill it with bar oil; filling it about halfway will last a whole battery. Store it with a rag or old cardboard under it to soak up the leaking oil.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Has considerable cutting power for a battery powered chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: I use a chain saw only once or twice a year which is not ideal for a gas powered model. I found this saw to have excellent cutting ability and power. I like the rapid stop of the blade when the trigger is released. I was able to do multiple cuts on a single charge with plenty of charge left. The saw is fairly heavy compared to the 14 inch Echo gas powered model I used before, however, it is well balanced and maneuverable.
customer_reviews.author: EZ

customer_reviews.title: Better than its equal in a gas saw
customer_reviews.text: I have a 60 acre farm and I heat my house with at least 3 cords of wood a year. I love this saw. I would hands down take this saw over my 16 inch steel saw. This is now my small saw behind my 24" husqvarna. This comes in super handy because you dont have to start and stop it all the time. I also have 5 batteries for blowers and weed whackers but 2 batteries is plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working on second use
customer_reviews.text: I really like DeWalt tools have many and work awesome. The chainsaw however has several dislikes oil leaks if you do not empty every time used what a mess. Stopped working half way through a tree trimming of limbs. I think over heated just a guess. The down side to ordering on line is the hassle of returning and down time without having chainsaw. For the price and convenience I went and bought another chainsaw and weed wacker different brand (well known brand) for ten dollars more ($359.00). The DeWalt saw is very expensive need to figure out the problems with this product however you are also paying for the name.
customer_reviews.author: John Fields

customer_reviews.title: Quality you would expect of Dewalt products.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to start using out of the box. Chain oil required. Much quieter than the gas model it replaced. Cut through limbs with ease. Not too heavy to lift over ones head to reach branches. Battery is very expensive. Does not come with a carrying case- wish it was available.
customer_reviews.author: J. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic for the home owner with a bit of property
customer_reviews.text: We have about 1 acre abutting a forest area in a suburban area. This unit is great for trimming back the tree growth, cutting old stumps flush to the ground, and processing larger branch / fallen tree dead-fall after storms. Less noise than a gas lawn mower, so no problems disturbing the neighbors; super easy to just pull out and go. Really nice for this application, but I don't think this saw would take the place of anyone's Stihl as a daily use tool in a work setting.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: REally useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: So much more convenient than my gas powered saw. The battery runs the chain saw for quite a while. I get tired before the saw stops. Cuts well, great for clearing saplings and brush, and for limbing downed trees. I like it. My one complaint is the ridiculously high cost of an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of 36" stumps I just need to chop little peices off until they're gone and this saw is doing a good job at cutting through them little by little. It's quiet and I'm in no big hurry but even digging in all 16 inches it really never slowed down. The chain never popped off. I got tired before it did.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H.

customer_reviews.title: Tree slayer!
customer_reviews.text: My dad purchased this to cut down a dead tree. This saw cut through it easily and last for a long time. It is easy to run and preformed great. He is a logger and always used gas powered saws. But he said this one would hold up to gas ones really well for yard work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Head to Tail BBQ

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Is great chainsaw but after 2 years sounds like a gear inside has worn down such that any friction on the chain results in high pitch whine. Will have to take apart to see what is going on but betting there is a plastic gear in there somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: kunkle

customer_reviews.title: Now my favorite saw
customer_reviews.text: It’s just downright awesome. Plenty of power. I’ve cut 20 inch logs. Getting an extra battery is a must I bought two extra batteries that came with a one hour charger works out great. It’s become my favorite saw. I hear you can get an 18 inch bar for it. You can cut set it down, move brush, pick it up pull the trigger and you’re ready to go no pull starting. Works great ...really easy to handle when you’re up in a tree or on a ladder or in a bucket !!!
customer_reviews.author: Newell Adair

customer_reviews.title: Over promise, under deliver
customer_reviews.text: It was a big investment for poor returns. After 18 months of occasional use, it died. I would not buy a battery-powered chainsaw again. Liked the idea of it, but the reality disappointed me. Don't mind paying if the item delivers on promises. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Haddock

customer_reviews.title: Great Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great Chain Saw. Got this yesterday and used it to cut down a bush. The bush had old hard dead wood around the trunk. The trunk was about 7 to 8 inches thick. This saw cut threw the trunk and dry hard dead wood like super soft wood. Pros 1. comes with a 9 Ah 60 Volt battery 2. no gas 3. no pull starting 4. super quite Cons 1. comes with a low end charger. Would probable take 1.5 hours instead of 1 hour to charge battery. Would recommend. Thinking of dumping my old gas echo chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Layton

customer_reviews.title: I won't have to deal with ethanol
customer_reviews.text: Product is medium weight, well balanced, and adequate battery life. Auto oiler works well and is easy to reill. Chain tensioning (and If necessary, re-inserting the chain into the bar channel) is easy. It cuts great, but it should with the new chain. Plenty of power on a full charge. If I were working it hard I'd buy a second battery and switch them as I was cutting. All in all very pleased (not cheap)
customer_reviews.author: kdubie

customer_reviews.title: It also uses the chain oil pretty fast so you have to keep an eye on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier than a gas powered chain saw. Had a tree fall in the yard and all I had to do was pop in the battery and start cutting. No effort at all for this saw. Cut 8 inch limbs with no trouble. You do have to be careful how you store it though as the chain oil tends to leak out over time. It also uses the chain oil pretty fast so you have to keep an eye on it while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice not having to mess with gas and to not having to yank a cord until I'm worn out. It starts right up. The battery only lasted about 30 minutes, but that was non-stop cutting. I was cutting swedish fire logs, so almost no down time. It seems to cut faster than my gas-powered 16". Oh, and it was a nice surprise that the bar and chain already came hooked up. I literally just had to charge up the battery and it was ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DEWALT DCCS670B FLEXVOLT 60V MAX Brushless Chainsaw (Tool Only)
customer_reviews.text: I used it right away and I like it. I had bought the smaller 12" model and by golly that little saw works fine. this bigger model seems to be just fine also. for the quick chores outside the house this thing it great. very practical compared to my gas saws. for the heavy jobs I go to my gas saws but for the close to house wood cutting for the steam bath its great.
customer_reviews.author: amaz pennam

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I’m a surprised by this chainsaw. As a homeowner, I often need to cut up limbs. Then it is a year before I do it again. With my gas saw, I’d spend hours getting it to crank after sitting for so long. Not with this! Pop the battery in and make sure there is bar oil and I’m cutting! It is great for someone that doesn’t need to cut that much. The battery lasts long enough for me to be tired of cutting. Then I put it on the charger while I clean up what I just cut. It works for me.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Conyers III

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt has done it again...
customer_reviews.text: Making cordless battery tools operate even better than their gas counterparts!! The 60V system has huge power and 9AH lasts a long time... easily as long as one tank of gas per 9AH battery and there is no difficult starting - ever! Has gobs of power... not quite as much as gas but, pretty darn close. Not having to start it more than makes up for the slightly lower power output - IMHO. Especially when your in a tree or on a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Harry A. McColl

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt 16" chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This battery operated saw is powerful enough to do what I want it to do. (small trees, limbs, some artsy work) I bit into a hidden piece of metal, ruined the chain. Finding a "Dewalt" replacement has been problematic. I had to settle for a build at the local saw shop... not quite the same as the OEM chain. So far the saw/battery/useage has been good. Bought what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Baton

customer_reviews.title: does all its supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Good cutting power for an electric. Lighter than most gas chainsaws. Good for limbing and saplings. Real trees still need a gas saw. Overall better than I expected. My only criticism is the chain drive apparatus is flimsy...does not bode well for the long term. Rated tops by CU.
customer_reviews.author: grey ghost

customer_reviews.title: Flexvolt is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I've only cut down a few treestbishes with this so far; it's incredibly convenient, though obviously less power than a gas powered unit. Make sure you keep the chain oiled! Mine was dull and thrown off in no time, because I thought I'd only make a few cuts to try it out, but had so much fun I kept on going for the equivalent of about 20 minutes of cutting (green horn mistake). Handy tool to have around - I think I now have most of the Flexvolt tools - I love them all.
customer_reviews.author: Rienk Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I am a Dewalt fan so wanted to try this chain saw. I was a little worried about the power due to being battery operated but to my surprise it is very powerful. Lately Dewalt is being more strict on replacing tools under warranty so hopefully we don't have an issues down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: very impressed, even thoguh it is battery powered.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not disappointing. Works as well as the one's you get that plug into 110volts Ac. Battery life is very decent, cut down and cut up some 30+ foot tall pine trees and it just keeps going. Is great for an assist when chopping off branches after felling really big trees too.
customer_reviews.author: Rawze

customer_reviews.title: Tons of power.
customer_reviews.text: Huge power, was surprised how well this chainsaw works. Comes with the new 9.0ah battery which was a nice option. Would definitely recommend this saw. Does require bar and chain oil so make sure to pick some of that up before your first use.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great saw around the yard, if you have a small yard
customer_reviews.text: Overall as a chain saw i like it a lot. My one complaint is that the battery doent last longer than 10 cuts for average sized logs, and worse it takes 2-3 hours to charge back up. Nice to have in a pinch but don't depend on doing any real work in 20 minute operational windows.
customer_reviews.author: DanBix

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for the little things I bought it for. Probably not the right chainsaw if your cutting down a bunch of big stuff. But for the 3-6” diameter limbs and bushes I needed removed this worked perfect! Battery life didn’t seem to be an issue for me. Although it’s always good to have a backup charging just Incase.
customer_reviews.author: jason Walmsley

customer_reviews.title: This Chain Saw Will Change Your Mind About Electrics
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was getting a backup for my gas saws (Stihls) when running out of fuel and chains getting dull. The Dewalt brushless saw changed my attitude about electric chain saws. The 60V 9amp battery is a brute and gives the power and endurance needed to get the job done. I cut firewood and sculpt planter boxes out of logs and need a reliable tool for the job. Quieter and lighter equals fun. I was laughing at my self trying to turn it off before setting it down like a normal saw. If the battery technology continues to progress at the current rate, electric chain saws are the future.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these. One lasted 5 minutes and died completely with full battery. The second one works but the Oiler stopped working third time using. Worthless now because the blade get super hot and doesn’t cut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular Chain saw
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Chain saw that i owned. I have used chain saws that i borrowed from my neighbor numerous times. This battery operated is very easy to use. No cord pullings. A full battery can cut around 25 to 30 sections of 8 to 10 inch diameter oak trees. it goes through the wood like butter. Beautiful machine. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt 60v flexvolt 16" chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive. Plenty of power. Need to have 2 batteries for a decent sized tree 30 feet or so and with a base over 16"s. I was able to drop the tree and cut it in to 20" long pieces. Shocked my neighbors with the power and no noise. One major benefit is I could set the saw down between cuts to figure out my next move or take a break and not have to start the saw and shut it down over and over. If you have realistic expectarions you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Boomshaka

customer_reviews.title: A beast of a chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!!! I don't even use my gas chainsaw anymore. Plenty of power for most of your cutting needs. I was very impressed with this product. I didn't expect much but was quite shocked by its performance. Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Jacoby

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful tool
customer_reviews.text: I've cut firewood for 50 years and this is a GREAT chainsaw for climbing ladders, crawling through the brush, reaching through obstacles, to cut limbs and small trees. I love it. It only accepts a narrow-kerf chain (Oregon) so I still use my gas-powered saw for big jobs of bucking firewood 8" and up.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR I'M IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it yet, but was very impressed by it upon arrival; well packaged, fully assembled (except for the battery). Seems sturdy. When this below zero weather departs from Texas I've got a pile of mesquite logs to convert into grill lengths and split. When I run it, I will shoot a video and post it here with more comments.
customer_reviews.author: PJDSR

product_meta.title: DEWALT FLEXVOLT 60V MAX Chainsaw Kit, 3-Ah Battery, 16-Inch (DCCS670X1)
product_meta.description: Style:60V BatteryThe DEWALT DCCS670X1 60v MAX Brushless Chainsaw with 3.0AH battery features a low kick back 16" Oregon Bar and Chain for construction and outdoor cutting applications. It also offers a chain brake for added kick back protection. A tool free chain tensioning and bar tightening knob allows for proper bar clamping force. This chainsaw also features auto oiling for continuous lubrication, with a quarter turn oil cap for quick oil re fills. Up to 70 cuts per charge (on a 6" x 6" pressure treated pine wood). Specifications: Bar length at 16.0 inches, Bar type Oregon, 3.0ah Amp hour, unit weight at only 12.2pounds. Backed by Dewalt's 3 year limited warranty. Includes: 1) DCCS670 Brushless Chainsaw, 1) 60V MAX 3AH battery, 1) Charger, 1) Hard bar cover.
feature_bullets: Low Kick Back 16" Oregon Bar and Chain for construction and outdoor cutting applications
Tool Free chain tensioning and bar tightening knob for proper bar clamping force
Auto Oiling for continuous lubrication. Quarter turn oil cap for quick oil re fills
Chain brake for kick back protection
Lightweight and ergonomic design. Weight is 12.2 pounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars775 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
